channel.title: Has anyone in here worked with QnX?
channel.description: QNX is an RTOS (real time operating system) and is mainly used for embedded applications. It's very portable (will fit on a floppy disk WITH a gui) and yet very powerful. I'm working on building a small os image for a PC104 board with a compact flash IDE device. Just looking to see if anyone in here has any experience in it. I'm having some trouble with creating a .boot file that actually works and the forums I've found that deal with it specifically have turned out to be rather useless.

item.title: Has anyone in here worked with QnX?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

No need anymore. I have taken QnX by the throat, beaten it furiously, and made it my bitch.

Problems solved.

Read full topic
